title: Understanding Graduated Guidance
text: Graduated guidance is a teaching strategy often used to help individuals learn new skills. It involves providing support and gradually reducing it as the learner becomes more proficient.

title: How Graduated Guidance Works
text: In graduated guidance, the teacher or parent provides physical prompts from behind the learner. As the learner becomes more capable, the prompts are gradually reduced until the learner can perform the task independently.

hintAnswer: graduated guidance, where you prompt from behind and try to back off whenever you can
title: Identifying the Correct Strategy
text: Which of the following describes the correct use of graduated guidance?
choices: graduated guidance, where you prompt from behind and try to back off whenever you can
graduated guidance, where you are $$hands-off$$ until you 'graduate'
graduated guidance, where you no longer use reinforcers
